item.title: Thoughts on Godot
item.description: Godot is a lot of fun to use and, in my opinion, may be the best platform available for teaching people how to program. Godot is very lightweight (~50mb) with no dependencies, it is completely open source under the MIT License, it supports both 2d and 3d game development, and its scripting language is python-esque. I think all of those things are excellent reasons for beginners to use Godot. However, that isn’t to say Godot doesn’t suit advanced programmers.
